column4: thus trying to figure it out...
yeah, good luck.. i been pulling my hair out over it for a week
which really isnt necessary (just mount it somewhere) and could suck big time if a large file got split across the drives
true enough... which is why I'm not using LVM  ;)
I've never seen anything refering to that... LVM, you can have disks on many computers act like one though... all your systems can share a central virtual harddrive...
don't ask me... thats the idea behind LVM1/2 though
Red Hat is pushing LVM2 also, so you may want to get your head around it somwhat... everything Red Hat pushes becomes a defacto standard in the Linux world eventually...
as soon as i find it ont he wiki, i intend to
so long as its correct, I don't see why not  :)
if you have some time... and some patience... couldn't do any harm
sudo apt-get install xorg-driver-fglrx xorg-driver-fglrx-dev fglrx-control
